abstracts.cdata!:
Morocco's economic reform program
            aims at achieving a sustainable increase in the rate of
            economic growth in order to ensure employment opportunities
            and acceptable living standards for its growing population,
            while enhancing external creditworthiness. The Second
            Structural Adjustment Loan (SAL 2) will support the last
            phase of the Government's stabilization and adjustment
            program of action within a macroeconomic framework which
            permits the Government's objectives. The loan will
            focus on the following areas: i) a public expenditure
            rationalization component which will support private
            investment by providing the necessary infrastructure,
            encouraging the private sector to supply some of the
            services hitherto supplied by the public sector, and
            promoting a dynamic role for private investment; ii) a
            poverty alleviation component which will support a shift in
            budget expenditure priorities toward the social sectors and
            the implementation of a poverty alleviation strategy for the
            nineties; and iii) the continuation of the trade reform
            program and the simplification of foreign trade procedures.
